Articles.Content:
Ever since I updated to MechJeb 2 it seems the docking pilot doesn't work

It approaches to within 11-20 meters and then starts backing away again, if I turn the auto pilot off and on again it will get closer again to the same distance then back away, endlessly repeating till I run out of RCS, anyone else have this experience?
It could be a problem with final alignment ? Is your target ship moving at all ? Have you tried with ASAS or Smart ASS activated on the target ships ?
It's a bug with the current prerelease version... It's been reported by lots of people. At least, before the forum rollback it was.
Yes, ppl were saying that 2.0.7 fixed it, but not really. Its not in realse notes at least and it doesnt work for me much better than before.

Still un-fixed in 2.0.8.0. The scenario I'm seeing in about three in four approaches: Vehicle stops about six meters short of contact, corrects to docking axis, moves in about 50 cm, stops and corrects, moves in another 25, stops and corrects; eventually stops dead a few meters out showing status "Approaching at 0.0 meters / sec" or "Moving toward docking axis at 0.0 meters/sec." Sometimes disabling the autopilot, nudging it towards target and re-enabling puts it back on track, sometimes it just corrects to axis and stops again. Makes no difference whether or not target is SAS-stabilized. Very time- and fuel-consuming.

Glad it's not just me. I've got 2.0.8 and all I'm doing is the back and forth burn the fuel maneuver. Normally I'd just dock it myself but I tend to make some big arse ships and can't get the view I need to dock manually. I do hope they put an emphasis on fixing this feature.
